title: Madonna of Humility
description: Madonna met lelie. Zittende Maria met een lelie in haar rechterhand, de linkerarm om de benen van het Christuskind staande op haar schoot.
plaqueDescriptionDutch: As a Dominican monk, artist Fra Angelico was able to avoid the strict rules of the Florentine guilds. That allowed him to develop his own personal style: remarkably realistic, with big forms and a rather sweet quality derived from the older painting traditions of Siena and Florence.

acquisition.creditLine: Purchased with the support of the Vereniging Rembrandt

iconClassDescription: Mary sitting or enthroned, the Christ-child standing on her knee (Christ-child to Mary's left)
'Madonna dell'UmiltÃ ' (usually Mary suckling the Christ-child while sitting on the ground)

longTitle: Madonna of Humility, Fra Angelico, c. 1440

scLabelLine: Fra Angelico (c. 1400–1455), Florence, c. 1440, tempera on panel

label.title: Madonna of Humility
label.makerLine: Fra Angelico (c. 1400–1455), Florence, c. 1440, tempera on panel
label.description: As a Dominican monk, Fra Angelico was not subject to the strict rules of the Florentine painters’ guild. He was thus free to develop a more personal style. This combined strong realism and solid forms with a certain sweetness partly derived from earlier Sienese and Florentine examples.
